Best Answer: It happens because of the bonding in the two compounds. Potassium chloride is an ionic compound, meaning it has polar bonds which, in water, causes it to be dissolved, as the stronger polar bonds in water pull them apart. Potassium has metallic bonding, so it can't be pulled apart by the water.
